humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, one out of the two sentinel lymph nodes examined has metastatic carcinoma (0.6 cm deposit), while the other one is negative for carcinoma. This corresponds to the N1 stage based on the new rules provided, specifically New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (No/Total).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic carcinoma to one lymph node (0.6 cm deposit), as indicated in the report. Therefore, the N stage is N1. The notation '(sn)' in the pathologic staging indicates that it is a sentinel lymph node. The number of lymph nodes examined is 2, with 1 lymph node having a macrometastasis (>0.2 cm).
